channel.title: Comments on: Corona Geek #76 – Flappy Bird, Why Was It Successful, Why Was It Removed

item.title: By: develephant
item.dc:creator: develephant
item.content:encoded:
@Nick – Actually, Nintendo stated that they had nothing to do with the removal. I’m sorry to hear you’re having some issues with them. Good luck.

http://toucharcade.com/2014/02/10/nintendo-didnt-remove-of-flappy-bird/

Best

item.title: By: Charles McKeever
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: Good observation Nick. It's very easy to comment from the stand, but I'm sure the developer feels/felt a very real element of stress that just wasn't desired. Some people would just say, "oh well" and keep moving forward. But, not everyone is built that way. Hope your dealings go smoothly.
item.content:encoded: Good observation Nick. It’s very easy to comment from the stand, but I’m sure the developer feels/felt a very real element of stress that just wasn’t desired. Some people would just say, “oh well” and keep moving forward. But, not everyone is built that way. Hope your dealings go smoothly.

item.title: By: Nick Nebelsky
item.dc:creator: Nick Nebelsky
item.description: You guys all missed the point with Flappy Birds. I wish I was in this conversation. Why? This is ironically happening to me right now with two of my apps. It's stress related! Dealing with lawyers, and Nintendo!
item.content:encoded: You guys all missed the point with Flappy Birds. I wish I was in this conversation. Why? This is ironically happening to me right now with two of my apps. It’s stress related! Dealing with lawyers, and Nintendo!
